description.narrative:
The total amount of remittances is much higher than the total amount of all official development aid worldwide. The flow of remittances tends as well to be more stable than other capital flows (Adams 2009, Giuliano & Ruiz-Arranz 2008, Moyo 2010,World Bank). But it is no clear whether the individual remittances actually make a difference. Oxfam Novib is working with organized communities and is interested in the potential for community remittance and its impact on development of the South and what the relation is between gender and Remittances.This year through this project, Afro-Euro will lobby/do campaigning and discuss the gender roles with the communities and other actors, to be aware about the gender justice aspects and what has been realized and has to be done in the near future when it come on the role of men and women sending or doing investment from their remittances.
Therefore,The main objective of this project on Gender & Remittances campaign for Ghana is to formulate recommendation and capacity building materials on the genderdimensions of remittance. This recommendation is for all the stakeholders that are dealing with remittances, especially the Diaspora in The Netherlands and in Europe. It is important to have identified the role of gender in remittance; in policy, programming andprojects that seek to harness the development potential of remittances. In order to achieve this objective, Afro-Euro has set theseshort-term and long-term objectives. Short-term: • The contribution of Ghanaian to the development of their countries and their communities of origin on a gender justice based • To clarify on the impact of the remittances on their status within the family and community • To discover how remittance is affecting gender roles, power relations and decision making processes in households and communities of origin. • capacity building materials on the gender dimensions of remittance for Ghana Long-term: Through this campaigningproject, Afro-Euro hopes to create increased knowledge and understanding the gender related issues within the remittances topic.

participating-org.narrative: The mission of Afro-Euro Foundation is to have an added value for the development of Ghana and the Ghanaian in the Netherland. To achieve this create a forum for inter-cultural exchange between peoples of African origin and their hosts’ nations in the spirit of promoting the identity of African — Europeans. The primary goal of the organization is the encouragement and promotion the added value of the Diaspora for the development of the South and also raising awareness of the gender balance in all aspect in the communities

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: no. of cases by nationally and globally operating partner organisations documenting examples of alternative economic models, together with knowledge institutes
